# Photo Metadata Editor

Organize your photos with consistent metadata and file naming.

## What It Does

- **View & Edit Metadata** - Read/write EXIF and XMP tags on photos
- **Create Templates** - Save reusable metadata for different photo types
- **Smart Naming** - Rename files using custom patterns with date, camera, location, etc.
- **Batch Processing** - Apply changes to multiple photos at once
- **Safe Operations** - Preview before applying, undo if needed

## Quick Start

```bash
python3 photo_meta_editor.py
```

1. Add photos (drag & drop or click "Open Files")
2. Create a template or use pre-made ones
3. Apply template to add metadata
4. Rename files with naming conventions
5. Done!

- JPEG (.jpg, .jpeg)
- TIFF (.tif, .tiff)
- PNG (.png)

## Ready-to-Use Templates

The [`example_templates/`](https://github.com/michael6gledhill/Photo_Metadata_App_By_Gledhill/tree/main/example_templates) folder includes:

**Metadata Templates:**
- Portrait Professional
- Travel Photography
- Wedding Photography
- Event Photography
- Stock Photography

**Naming Conventions:**
- Date + Sequence
- Timestamp + Camera
- User + Date + Title
- Original + Sequence
- Year-Month + Title

Import these directly in the app using the **Import** button, or copy & paste the JSON.
